alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 8:20AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southern California, including the following counties, in southern California, Riverside and San Bernardino. In southwest California, Orange and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain slowly clearing the area. Runoff will continue flooding in some areas. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from this storm, saturating soils. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Ontario, Corona, Orange, Fullerton, Temecula, Rialto, Chino, Redlands, Yorba Linda, Lake Elsinore, Yucaipa, Hemet, Forest Falls and I-15 Through The Cajon Pass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego
